record.text: I'll just reiterate my response from before, which is that functionally clients aren't really independent from appviews so proxying through the pds doesn't buy that much

this post is great and, tangentially, what i’ve been surprised by with lexicons is how appview-centric they are.

firehose and pds were my entryways to atproto, so record-type lexicons connect for me. but i’ve found it’s actually kind of hard to browse lexicons if all you care about is record types.

record.text: It's a little challenging to discuss subsystems as atproto or not. Separating the appview concept from use of the pds and repo is certainly possible -- you can replace it with another approach and implementation -- but in practice it's a bit like talking about the Web as independent from DNS. Sorta.

It's a little challenging to discuss subsystems as atproto or not. Separating the appview concept from use of the pds and repo is certainly possible -- you can replace it with another approach and implementation -- but in practice it's a bit like talking about the Web as independent from DNS. Sorta.

images.alt:
4 minutes ago
Colby Smith
"As you know, we inherited, from the last administration, an economic catastrophe and an inflation nightmare."
— President Trump
This is misleading.
President Trump inherited an economy in solid shape, by most metrics.
The number of job vacancies is no longer at a record high and hiring has slowed, but layoffs overall remain low.
After rising last summer, the unemployment rate has stabilized at 4 percent, not too far from a roughly half-century low. Wages continue to rise, too, even if at a more modest pace and growth has stayed resilient.
In the final quarter of 2024, U.S. gross domestic product, adjusted for inflation, grew at a 2.3 percent annual rate. For the year as a whole, measured from the end of 2023 to the end of 2024, G.D.P increased 2.5 percent.

value.text:
